item.title: 博德之门 3》制作人承诺《神界》将 "更上一层楼
item.description: Larian 首席执行官 Vincke 说："我认为这款游戏会比《博德之门 3》好得多。【原文：‘I think this one is going to be way better’ than ‘Baldur’s Gate 3,’ Larian CEO Vincke says】

item.title: 美国失业率超预期后，国债出现波动
item.description: 美国 11 月失业率超出预期，增强了美联储 2026 年进一步降息的预期，国债走高。【原文：Treasuries edged higher after the US November unemployment rate exceeded estimates, bolstering expectations for further Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts in 2026.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司推迟支付 250 万英镑的管理人员奖金
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）本月推迟向高级管理人员支付近 250 万英镑（约合 340 万美元）的奖金，以应对在该公司被评为英国污染最严重的供应商之一时不奖励员工的压力。【原文：Thames Water has deferred payment of almost £2.5 million ($3.4 million) in bonuses to its senior managers this month bowing to pressure not to reward staff while the company is ranked among the worst-polluting suppliers in the UK.】

item.title: Glencore 通过收购项目增强秘鲁铜业实力
item.description: Glencore Plc 收购了秘鲁现有采矿业务附近的一个项目，从而加强了其在秘鲁的地位，这也是该公司全球铜矿扩张战略的一部分。【原文：Glencore Plc is strengthening its position in Peru with the purchase of a project near its existing mining operations, part of the company’s global copper expansion strategy.】

item.title: 美国 10 月就业人数减少 64,000 人，失业率上升
item.description: 美国 11 月份的就业增长依然疲软，失业率升至四年来的新高，表明劳动力市场在经历了 10 月份的疲软之后继续降温。【原文：US job growth remained sluggish in November and the unemployment rate rose to a four-year high, pointing to a continued cooling in the labor market after a weak October.】

item.title: 美国零售销售因汽车购买量下降而停滞不前
item.description: 美国 10 月份的零售额变化不大，原因是汽车经销商的销售额下降，汽油收入减少，抵消了其他类别消费的增长。【原文：US retail sales were little changed in October as a decline at auto dealers and weaker gasoline receipts offset stronger spending in other categories.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利郑永年：科技带来 "多年 "并购繁荣
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的一位资深银行家表示，在今年创下并购纪录之后，技术交易商们的并购活动才刚刚开始。【原文：Technology dealmakers are just beginning a supercharged period of mergers and acquisitions activity after racking up a record run this year, according to a senior Morgan Stanley banker.】

item.title: Databricks 以 1,340 亿美元估值融资 40 多亿美元
item.description: Databricks 在新一轮融资中筹集了 40 多亿美元，这家私营软件公司的估值达到 1,340 亿美元。【原文：Databricks is raising over $4 billion in a new funding round that values the private software firm at $134 billion.】

item.title: 适应人工智能时代，Mozilla 将火狐浏览器老板提升为首席执行官
item.description: Mozilla 公司将火狐浏览器（Firefox）的负责人提升为公司的首席执行官，该公司正试图将自己定位为独立的、注重隐私的大科技公司的替代者。【原文：Mozilla Corp. elevated the head of its Firefox web browser to chief executive officer of the company, which is trying to position itself as an independent, privacy-focused alternative to Big Tech options.】

item.title: 石油流量和价格骤降，俄罗斯的军需品遭重创
item.description:
原油发货量创下自乌克兰入侵以来的最大单周降幅

。【原文：

Crude shipments registered their biggest week-on-week drop since the invasion of Ukraine

】

item.title: 看涨押注增加，欧盟碳价延续涨势，创两年新高
item.description: 欧盟碳期货延续涨势，创下两年多来的最高点，原因是供应趋紧的前景使基金继续看涨，从而增加了发电成本。【原文：European Union carbon futures extended a rally to the highest in more than two years as funds remain bullish due to the outlook for tighter supplies, adding to costs for generating electricity.】

item.title: 匈牙利维持关键利率不变，投资者关注新的通胀预测
item.description: 在匈牙利中央银行公布新的通胀预测之前，匈牙利一如预期维持其关键利率不变，投资者将仔细研究新的通胀预测，以寻找任何转向宽松货币政策的迹象。【原文：Hungary kept its key interest rate unchanged as expected before the publication of the central bank’s new inflation projections, which investors will scrutinize for any sign of a pivot toward monetary easing.】

item.title: 芝加哥因 "就业杀手 "税引发恐慌，Citadel 离开芝加哥大厦
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，在亿万富翁肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）离开芝加哥前往佛罗里达三年后，Citadel 公司正在缩小其在芝加哥的业务范围，将该公司在芝加哥的剩余业务迁出以其名字命名的市中心大厦。【原文：Citadel is shrinking its footprint in Chicago three years after billionaire owner Ken Griffin left for Florida, moving the company’s remaining operations in the city out of the downtown tower that was named for it, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝森特表示本周将有更多美联储访谈，预计一月将有新消息
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，本周还有一到两次美联储下任主席的面试，唐纳德-特朗普总统可能会在 1 月初的某个时候宣布。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said there are one or two more interviews this week for the next chair of the Federal Reserve, with a likely announcement by President Donald Trump sometime in early January.】

item.title: 在等待美国就业报告的过程中，人工智能的低迷削弱了新兴市场股票的表现
item.description: 由于投资者继续撤出人工智能类股票，新兴市场股票又将迎来一个跌幅超过 1%的交易日。【原文：Emerging-market stocks are heading for another day of losses of more than 1% as investors continued to pull out of artificial intelligence stocks.】

item.title: 通胀改革迫在眉睫，摩洛哥维持利率不变
item.description: 摩洛哥中央银行维持基准利率不变，表明在准备转向通胀目标制的过程中要谨慎行事。【原文：Morocco’s central bank left its benchmark interest rate unchanged, signaling caution as it prepares to shift to an inflation-targeting system.】

item.title: 美国 11 月份就业报告分析
item.description: 新泽西州一家履行中心的工人。摄影师：Michael Nagle/Bloomberg【原文：A worker at a fulfillment center in New Jersey. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg】

item.title: 西班牙猪瘟疫情扩大，又有 10 头野猪死亡
item.description: 西班牙报告了 10 例新的非洲猪瘟野猪死亡病例，疫情的扩大使这个主要猪肉出口国进入了高度警戒状态。【原文：Spain reported 10 new cases of wild boar deaths from African swine fever, expanding an outbreak that has put the major pork exporter into high alert.】

item.title: 英国有 73.5 万年轻人失业，失业率创十年新高
item.description: 英国青年失业率飙升至十年来的最高点，因为就业市场放缓对那些初入劳动力市场的人打击最大，这给首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）陷入困境的工党政府带来了新的压力。【原文：UK youth unemployment has surged to the highest in a decade as a jobs market slowdown falls hardest on those starting out in the labor market, piling fresh pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s embattled Labour government.】

item.title: 米莱以比索为支点推动阿根廷重返债券市场
item.description: 通过解决投资者关心的两个关键问题：比索估值过高和硬通货储备短缺，阿根廷离重返国际债务市场更近了一步。【原文：Argentina moved closer to a return to international debt markets by addressing two key issues that have concerned investors: an overvalued peso and a shortage of hard-currency reserves.】

item.title: 巴西央行不会在通胀放缓之际宣布获胜
item.description: 巴西央行选择在何时开始放松货币政策方面保持一定程度的自由度，因为尽管经济活动疲软，但巴西的通胀预期在 2028 年之前仍高于目标值。【原文：Brazil’s central bank chose to keep a degree of freedom about when it will start easing monetary policy as inflation expectations remain above target through 2028 despite weaker economic activity.】

item.title: 美国进口商权衡特朗普关税退税的法律选项
item.description: 美国高等法院已休庭放假，这预示着对关税的裁决最快将于 1 月初做出【原文：The US high court has recessed for the holidays, signaling a ruling on tariffs no sooner than early January】

item.title: 印度电力计划放弃天然气，加倍使用煤炭
item.description: 该国的主要燃料仍然相对廉价和充足，其储量可以再持续一个世纪或更长时间。【原文：The country’s mainstay fuel remains relatively cheap and plentiful, with reserves to last another century or more.】

item.title: 拉里-埃里森在甲骨文人工智能赌局中发号施令
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，布罗迪-福特（Brody Ford）和德雷克-贝内特（Drake Bennett）将为您报道拉里-埃里森（Larry Ellison）为使甲骨文重返科技界前沿所下的赌注。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Brody Ford and Drake Bennett report on Larry Ellison’s bet to return Oracle to the forefront of the tech world.】

item.title: 2026 年快餐连锁店应转向更小、更便宜的餐食
item.description: 在经济紧张的情况下，牺牲在所难免。厨房装修，推迟。家庭度假，缩减规模。放弃刚做好的泔水碗。【原文：In a strained economy, sacrifices will inevitably be made. Kitchen renovations, postponed. Family vacations, downscaled. Freshly prepared slop bowls, forsaken.】

item.title: 日本央行在相互矛盾的需求中迎接充满挑战的一年
item.description: 人们普遍预计日本央行将在周五提高关键利率。前方的道路更加迷茫。【原文：The Bank of Japan is widely expected to raise its key rate on Friday. The path ahead gets murkier.】

item.title: 美国 2025 年最大规模 IPO 之路上，Medline 经受住了关税和延迟的考验
item.description: Medline Inc. 推迟已久的首次公开募股有望创下今年上市募集资金之最，因为热衷于这家医疗用品公司商业模式的投资者已经看淡了它重返公开市场的坎坷之路。【原文：Medline Inc.’s long-delayed initial public offering is on track to raise the most of any listing this year, as investors keen on the medical supply company’s business model look past its rocky path back to the public markets.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利债务排名攀升，成为人工智能领域的首选银行
item.description: 最近几个月，人们对人工智能泡沫的焦虑达到了白热化的程度，没有哪家华尔街银行能像摩根士丹利这样帮助这个行业冲破喧嚣。【原文：As anxiety over an artificial-intelligence bubble reached a fever pitch in recent months, no Wall Street bank helped the industry power past the noise like Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: Visa 使用 Circle 的 USDC 为美国银行提供稳定币结算服务
item.description: Visa 公司将向稳定币结算开放其美国网络，在特朗普第二届政府宽松的监管环境下，扩大与加密货币相关的产品和服务。【原文：Visa Inc. is opening its US network to stablecoin settlement, expanding crypto-linked products and services enabled by the relaxed regulatory environment under the second Trump administration.】

item.title: 美国最大规模的电力拍卖将加深人们对负担能力的担忧
item.description: 本周，发电商、监管机构和消费者都将密切关注美国电力市场拍卖的结果。【原文：The outcome of what was, until recently, an obscure US power market auction will be the subject of intense interest this week for electric generators, regulators and consumers alike.】
